Detailed Description

lowlevel socket management specific to a module instance (as opposed to the broker).

Member Function Documentation

void SBWModuleRPC::connect (  const char *    moduleName,
const char *    hostname = ""
)  [virtual]
 

connect this application process to the broker.

When this is invoked, the thread has not yet been started for SBWModuleRPC's run() method. So this is executed in the single initial thread.

Parameters:
moduleIdentificationString  module identification string which indicates module this application process is an instance of.
hostname  the hostname of machine on which you wish to connect. "" implies local

Definition at line 107 of file SBWModuleRPC.cpp.

void SBWModuleRPC::signalDisconnect (    )  [virtual]
 

send a message to the broker requesting that it disconnects from this application process.

This method doesn't block until the disconnect occurs but instead returns as soon as the message has been transmitted.

Implements SystemsBiologyWorkbench::SBWRPC.

unsigned char *    message,
Integer    length
)  [protected]
 

transmit a message to another module or the broker.

Parameters:
destinationModuleId  numeric moduleinstance identifier of the destination. guarenteed not to refer to this application. can refer to the broker.
message  data to be transmitted.
length  length of data.
